name: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2983
Reason: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone has a basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The presence of two amino groups increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding, which can raise it by approximately +50°C each. The ketone group also has the potential for hydrogen bonding, contributing around +20°C. The ethanone group also increases the molecular weight, which can raise the melting point by approximately +10°C. Summing up these changes: Benzene base (+5.5°C), two amino groups (+100°C), one ketone group (+20°C), and one ethanone group (+10°C).
